channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing person re-identification via Uncertainty Feature Fusion Method and Auto-weighted Measure Combination
item.description: On the Occluded-DukeMTMC dataset, our method increases Rank@1 by 22. 0% and mAP by 18. 4%.

item.title: FedMLLM: Federated Fine-tuning MLLM on Multimodal Heterogeneity Data
item.description: Fine-tuning MLLMs with Federated Learning (FL) allows for expanding the training data scope by including private data sources, thereby enhancing their practical applicability in privacy-sensitive domains.

item.title: Large Multi-modal Models Can Interpret Features in Large Multi-modal Models
item.description: Recent advances in Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) lead to significant breakthroughs in both academia and industry.

item.title: Towards Speaker Identification with Minimal Dataset and Constrained Resources using 1D-Convolution Neural Network
item.description: Voice recognition and speaker identification are vital for applications in security and personal assistants.

item.title: TEXGen: a Generative Diffusion Model for Mesh Textures
item.description: Instead, we focus on the fundamental problem of learning in the UV texture space itself.

item.title: Ordinal Multiple-instance Learning for Ulcerative Colitis Severity Estimation with Selective Aggregated Transformer
item.description: Patient-level diagnosis of severity in ulcerative colitis (UC) is common in real clinical settings, where the most severe score in a patient is recorded.

item.title: Multi-granularity Interest Retrieval and Refinement Network for Long-Term User Behavior Modeling in CTR Prediction
item.description: Recent advancements have shown that modeling rich user behaviors can significantly improve the performance of CTR prediction.

item.title: A Benchmark Dataset for Collaborative SLAM in Service Environments
item.description: C-SLAM, as a fundamental technique for multiple service robots, needs to handle diverse challenges such as homogeneous scenes and dynamic objects to ensure that robots operate smoothly and perform their tasks safely.

item.title: Exploring Foundation Models Fine-Tuning for Cytology Classification
item.description: Cytology slides are essential tools in diagnosing and staging cancer, but their analysis is time-consuming and costly.

item.title: SPAC-Net: Rethinking Point Cloud Completion with Structural Prior
item.description: Point cloud completion aims to infer a complete shape from its partial observation.

item.title: Can GNNs Learn Link Heuristics? A Concise Review and Evaluation of Link Prediction Methods
item.description: This paper explores the ability of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in learning various forms of information for link prediction, alongside a brief review of existing link prediction methods.

item.title: Learnable Activation Functions in Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Solving Partial Differential Equations
item.description: We investigate the use of learnable activation functions in Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs).

item.title: Many happy returns: machine learning to support platelet issuing and waste reduction in hospital blood banks
item.description: Efforts to reduce platelet wastage in hospital blood banks have focused on ordering policies, but the predominant practice of issuing the oldest unit first may not be optimal when some units are returned unused.

item.title: Multiset Transformer: Advancing Representation Learning in Persistence Diagrams
item.description: To improve persistence diagram representation learning, we propose Multiset Transformer.

item.title: AttriBoT: A Bag of Tricks for Efficiently Approximating Leave-One-Out Context Attribution
item.description: The influence of contextual input on the behavior of large language models (LLMs) has prompted the development of context attribution methods that aim to quantify each context span's effect on an LLM's generations.

item.title: Geminio: Language-Guided Gradient Inversion Attacks in Federated Learning
item.description: This is achieved by leveraging a pretrained VLM to guide the optimization of a malicious global model that, when shared with and optimized by a victim, retains only gradients of samples that match the attacker-specified query.

item.title: FairAdapter: Detecting AI-generated Images with Improved Fairness
item.description: The high-quality, realistic images generated by generative models pose significant challenges for exposing them. So far, data-driven deep neural networks have been justified as the most efficient forensics tools for the challenges.

item.title: Comparative Analysis of nnUNet and MedNeXt for Head and Neck Tumor Segmentation in MRI-guided Radiotherapy
item.description: We utilized the HNTS-MRG2024 dataset, which consists of 150 MRI scans from patients diagnosed with HNC, including original and registered pre-RT and mid-RT T2-weighted images with corresponding segmentation masks for GTVp and GTVn.

item.title: Leapfrog Latent Consistency Model (LLCM) for Medical Images Generation
item.description: We propose a Leapfrog Latent Consistency Model (LLCM) that is distilled from a retrained diffusion model based on the collected MedImgs dataset, which enables our model to generate real-time high-resolution images.

item.title: DiffusionDrive: Truncated Diffusion Model for End-to-End Autonomous Driving
item.description: However, the numerous denoising steps in the robotic diffusion policy and the more dynamic, open-world nature of traffic scenes pose substantial challenges for generating diverse driving actions at a real-time speed.

item.title: ScribeAgent: Towards Specialized Web Agents Using Production-Scale Workflow Data
item.description: Large Language Model (LLM) agents are rapidly improving to handle increasingly complex web-based tasks.

item.title: Locating the Leading Edge of Cultural Change
item.description: Measures of textual similarity and divergence are increasingly used to study cultural change.

item.title: A New Way: Kronecker-Factored Approximate Curvature Deep Hedging and its Benefits
item.description: This paper advances the computational efficiency of Deep Hedging frameworks through the novel integration of Kronecker-Factored Approximate Curvature (K-FAC) optimization.

item.title: OminiControl: Minimal and Universal Control for Diffusion Transformer
item.description: In this paper, we introduce OminiControl, a highly versatile and parameter-efficient framework that integrates image conditions into pre-trained Diffusion Transformer (DiT) models.

item.title: Recursive Gaussian Process State Space Model
item.description: Learning dynamical models from data is not only fundamental but also holds great promise for advancing principle discovery, time-series prediction, and controller design.

item.title: Cosmological Analysis with Calibrated Neural Quantile Estimation and Approximate Simulators
item.description: A major challenge in extracting information from current and upcoming surveys of cosmological Large-Scale Structure (LSS) is the limited availability of computationally expensive high-fidelity simulations.

item.title: Cross-Modal Pre-Aligned Method with Global and Local Information for Remote-Sensing Image and Text Retrieval
item.description: However, challenges remain in effectively integrating global and local information due to variations in remote sensing imagery and ensuring proper feature pre-alignment before modal fusion, which affects retrieval accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: FOCUS: Knowledge-enhanced Adaptive Visual Compression for Few-shot Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: To this end, we introduce the knowledge-enhanced adaptive visual compression framework, dubbed FOCUS, which uniquely combines pathology FMs with language prior knowledge to enable a focused analysis of diagnostically relevant regions by prioritizing discriminative WSI patches.

item.title: Evaluating Vision Transformer Models for Visual Quality Control in Industrial Manufacturing
item.description: One of the most promising use-cases for machine learning in industrial manufacturing is the early detection of defective products using a quality control system.

item.title: BERT-Based Approach for Automating Course Articulation Matrix Construction with Explainable AI
item.description: This work demonstrates the potential of utilizing transfer learning with BERT-based models for the automated generation of CAMs, offering high performance and interpretability in educational outcome assessment.

item.title: FedRAV: Hierarchically Federated Region-Learning for Traffic Object Classification of Autonomous Vehicles
item.description: However, considering the complicated traffic environments and driving scenarios, deploying federated learning for autonomous vehicles is inevitably challenged by non-independent and identically distributed (Non-IID) data of vehicles, which may lead to failed convergence and low training accuracy.

item.title: Insight-V: Exploring Long-Chain Visual Reasoning with Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we present Insight-V, an early effort to 1) scalably produce long and robust reasoning data for complex multi-modal tasks, and 2) an effective training pipeline to enhance the reasoning capabilities of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs).

item.title: Robust Detection of Watermarks for Large Language Models Under Human Edits
item.description: We prove that the Tr-GoF test achieves optimality in robust detection of the Gumbel-max watermark in a certain asymptotic regime of substantial text modifications and vanishing watermark signals.

item.title: DRPruning: Efficient Large Language Model Pruning through Distributionally Robust Optimization
item.description: To address this, we propose DRPruning, which incorporates distributionally robust optimization to restore balanced performance across domains, along with further improvements to enhance robustness.

item.title: Persistent Homology for Structural Characterization in Disordered Systems
item.description: We propose a unified framework based on persistent homology (PH) to characterize both local and global structures in disordered systems.

item.title: Learning to Cooperate with Humans using Generative Agents
item.description: By sampling from the latent space, we can use the generative model to produce different partners to train Cooperator agents.

item.title: RestorerID: Towards Tuning-Free Face Restoration with ID Preservation
item.description: RestorerID is a diffusion model-based method that restores low-quality images with varying levels of degradation by using a single reference image.

item.title: Zero-Shot Low-Light Image Enhancement via Joint Frequency Domain Priors Guided Diffusion
item.description: To address this problem, we will propose a new zero-shot low-light enhancement method to compensate for the lack of light and structural information in the diffusion sampling process by effectively combining the wavelet and Fourier frequency domains to construct rich a priori information.

item.title: Stereo Anything: Unifying Stereo Matching with Large-Scale Mixed Data
item.description: To further enrich the model's ability to generalize across different conditions, we introduce a novel synthetic dataset that complements existing data by adding variability in baselines, camera angles, and scene types.

item.title: Regional Attention for Shadow Removal
item.description: Shadow, as a natural consequence of light interacting with objects, plays a crucial role in shaping the aesthetics of an image, which however also impairs the content visibility and overall visual quality.

item.title: UnifiedCrawl: Aggregated Common Crawl for Affordable Adaptation of LLMs on Low-Resource Languages
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) under-perform on low-resource languages due to limited training data.

item.title: G-RAG: Knowledge Expansion in Material Science
item.description: In the field of Material Science, effective information retrieval systems are essential for facilitating research.

item.title: Global and Local Attention-Based Transformer for Hyperspectral Image Change Detection
item.description: The global attention component employs global attention on downsampled feature maps to capture low-frequency information, while the local attention component focuses on high-frequency details using non-overlapping window-based local attention.

item.title: CLIPer: Hierarchically Improving Spatial Representation of CLIP for Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation
item.description: The proposed CLIPer includes an early-layer fusion module and a fine-grained compensation module.

item.title: REFOL: Resource-Efficient Federated Online Learning for Traffic Flow Forecasting
item.description: Therefore, we propose a novel method named Resource-Efficient Federated Online Learning (REFOL) for TFF, which guarantees prediction performance in a communication-lightweight and computation-efficient way.

item.title: Out-Of-Distribution Detection with Diversification (Provably)
item.description: Out-of-distribution (OOD) detection is crucial for ensuring reliable deployment of machine learning models.

item.title: NewsInterview: a Dataset and a Playground to Evaluate LLMs' Ground Gap via Informational Interviews
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities in generating coherent text but often struggle with grounding language and strategic dialogue.

item.title: Self-supervised learning for radio-astronomy source classification: a benchmark
item.description: This study explores the application of SSL to radio astronomy, comparing the performance of SSL-trained models with that of traditional models pretrained on natural images, evaluating the importance of data curation for SSL, and assessing the potential benefits of self-supervision to different domain-specific radio astronomy datasets.

item.title: GMAI-VL & GMAI-VL-5.5M: A Large Vision-Language Model and A Comprehensive Multimodal Dataset Towards General Medical AI
item.description: Despite significant advancements in general artificial intelligence, such as GPT-4, their effectiveness in the medical domain (general medical AI, GMAI) remains constrained due to the absence of specialized medical knowledge.

item.title: Star-Agents: Automatic Data Optimization with LLM Agents for Instruction Tuning
item.description: Our empirical studies, including instruction tuning experiments with models such as Pythia and LLaMA, demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework.
